results.title: Courtesy: the inside story
results.brief_description: Dramatises common complaints by food service staff about the guests they serve. Suggests ways of handling difficult situations courteously and with poise. Intended for staff training.

results.title: Courtesy, etiquette and attitude in the workplace
results.brief_description: Poor behaviour and practices of individuals in the workplace can impact on the group as a whole. The aim of this program is to identify inappropriate attitudes, behaviours and work habits and to introduce new measures which will improve the work ethic of an organisation. Critical issues addressed: bad manners; attitude; personal presentation; dealing with others and good manners. A training manual accompanies the program and may be borrowed as a separate loan item.

results.title: Courtesy for beginners
results.brief_description: Produced to stimulate an interest in good manners among young children. Students from a junior grade class practice such simple acts of good manners as being considerate to a guest, making correct introductions, and using such expressions as “please”, “thank you”, and “excuse me”.

results.title: Courtesy
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films, John Shearman and Richard Kilburn
results.brief_description: Thousands of passengers pass through London’s main stations every day, and during the rush hour platforms are a sea of faces. How do railway men or passengers retain a sense of courtesy in such a situation? How does the Station Master deal with difficult incidents? These are some of the questions asked in this film, and both staff and travellers put forward opinions. A film more likely to provoke discussions than to provide an answer.

results.title: Court of Petty Sessions
results.brief_description: A dramatised production examining a typical case at a Police Court in Perth - in this instance a car theft. The defendant pleads not guilty so a preliminary trial must be conducted. The testimony of the plaintiff and the defendant is presented and the importance if the subpoena is noted when one witness fails to attend.

results.title: Coup d'etat: the Philippines revolt
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Ian Carroll, Peter Couchman and Geoff Satchell
results.brief_description: A documentary of the four days in February 1986 when Ferdinand Marcos was deposed as President of the Philippines. Marcos defector, Defence Minister Enrile and coup leader Captain Gringo Honason discuss the planned attack on President Marcos and his first lady Imelda in their Palace, why it failed and how Cardinal Jamie Sin and the middle class people of Manila saved the lives of new President Cory Acquino and her Government.

results.title: Country town
results.creator_credit: Outback Films, Avargo, Fenton Rosewarne and Peter Maxwell
results.brief_description: Based on that very famous and popular ABC television series “Bellbird”, this feature film brings together all the main cast in yet another wonderfully put together story. The small country town of Bellbird is facing a crisis - one of its worst droughts in history. Can the farming community survive? Combining drama with romance and interspersed with some of that typical Aussie wit and humor, “Country town” faithfully recreates the warm charm of its original television series. Cast includes Gary Gray, Terry McDermott, Lynette Curran, Anne Charleston, Maurie Fields, Stella Lamond, Gerda Nicolson, Rosie Sturgess, Peter Cummins, Sheila Florance. Director of Photography: Bruce McNaughton.
